entries.title: Western Tanks Appear Headed to Ukraine, Breaking Another Taboo
entries.description: The West has sent an array of weapons once seen as too provocative, and it looks like tanks will be next. With a new Russian offensive expected, officials see an urgent need to shift the balance.

entries.title: Your Friday Briefing: Investigating Chinese Police Outposts Abroad
entries.description: Also, Xi Jinping changes his tone on business and South Korea considers nuclear weapons.

entries.title: Poland and Britain Consider Sending Leopard Tanks to Ukraine
entries.description: U.S. and European defense officials have long held concerns that giving Ukraine tanks could prompt Russia to escalate the war.

entries.title: Girl Guides of Canada Drops Brownies Name
entries.description: The organization adopted a new name, Embers, for the branch after current and former members said that the old one was a barrier to belonging.

entries.title: Russia Released US Navy Veteran  Quietly Detained for 9 Months
entries.description: The veteran, Taylor Dudley, had traveled to Poland to attend a music festival and “at some point crossed the Russian border,” a family spokesman said. It remained unclear on what charges he had been held.

entries.title: Exxon Scientists Predicted Global Warming, Even as Company Cast Doubts, Study Finds
entries.description: Starting in the 1970s, scientists working for the oil giant made remarkably accurate projections of just how much burning fossil fuels would warm the planet.

entries.title: Sri Lanka’s Former President Ordered to Pay Compensation Over 2019 Bombings
entries.description: A Supreme Court ruling denounced former President Maithripala Sirisena and some of his top officials for what it called “reckless failure” to prevent the attacks, which killed more than 200 people.

entries.title: Who Is Valery Gerasimov, the New Head of Russia’s War Effort in Ukraine?
Netanyahu Surges Ahead With Judicial Overhaul, Prompting Fury in Israel
entries.description: A proposal to weaken the Supreme Court has set off an early backlash against Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu’s new hard-right government.

entries.title: Pressure Mounts on Ukraine’s Allies to Provide Tanks
entries.description: Two European countries are considering sending tanks to Ukraine, a demand that it has made for months. Providing the weaponry to Ukraine was once considered off limits by Europe and the U.S.

entries.title: With F.B.I. Search, U.S. Escalates Global Fight Over Chinese Police Outposts
entries.description: Beijing says the outposts aren’t doing police work, but Chinese state media reports say they “collect intelligence” and solve crimes far outside their jurisdiction.

entries.title: From Disciplinarian to Cheerleader: Why China Is Changing Its Tone on Business
entries.description: With the economy in a fragile state, Chinese officials are starting to use more business-friendly language, and also to back their words with action.

entries.title: In a First, South Korea Declares Nuclear Weapons a Policy Option
entries.description: President Yoon Suk Yeol said that if North Korea’s nuclear threat grows, his country may build a nuclear arsenal of its own or ask the United States to redeploy in the South.​

entries.title: Driver in Guangzhou, China, Runs Down Pedestrians, Killing at Least 5
entries.description: The police in Guangzhou detained a 22-year-old man, who appeared to throw money in the air after striking the people. Thirteen people were injured.

entries.title: Your Thursday Briefing
entries.description: Aides have found more files retained by President Biden dating from his vice presidency.

entries.title: Video Shows Brazil Rioters Breaching Inadequate Security
entries.description: The invasion of Brazil’s halls of power began with a severe shortfall of security forces.

entries.title: U.S. and Japan Say They Will Strengthen Military Cooperation
entries.description: Top officials from the two nations are meeting in Washington this week to discuss tensions with China, Russia and North Korea and to plan for deterrence with U.S. troops and missiles.
